item.title: Bookreview
item.description: Hello These are my book reviews Goodreads. Reading ğŸ“—From Lukov with Love - Mariana ZapataRating: 4 â­ A solid 3.75 stars<br/><br/>Its not like the book is bad, quite the opposite. Its a page turner and I finished it in 2 days. The rating is because the book is soo predictable. If this is your first Mariana Zapata book, you might even love it. This being my 3rd book of the author, I was a little disappointed,
item.content:
Hello These are my book reviews Goodreads.

Reading

  • ğŸ“—From Lukov with Love - Mariana Zapata
    Rating: 4 â­

    A solid 3.75 stars<br/><br/>Its not like the book is bad, quite the opposite. Its a page turner and I finished it in 2 days. The rating is because the book is soo predictable. If this is your first Mariana Zapata book, you might even love it. This being my 3rd book of the author, I was a little disappointed,

  • ğŸ“—Daisy Jones & The Six - Taylor Jenkins Reid
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Malibu Rising - Taylor Jenkins Reid
    Rating: 3 â­

  • ğŸ“—The Paper Menagerie - Ken Liu
    Rating: 5 â­

    Its one of those stories which made me cry profusely by the end of it. The story may be short in length but it is in no way short when it comes to going deep into your heart and provoking all kinds of emotions. <br/><br/>It makes your realize the brevity of life and how one can spoil things that matter, just

  • ğŸ“—Kulti - Mariana Zapata
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Mary Jane - Jessica Anya Blau
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—The Rosie Project - Graeme Simsion
    Rating: 2 â­

    I decided to read this book because of its intriguing prelude. But after having read the book, I have to say that I was fairly disappointed. <br/><br/>I liked the idea behind the book, A project to find a partner. Questions like, 'How can this be a project', How would someone be convinced to take part in the

  • ğŸ“—Millennium, Vol. 1: The Girl With The Dragon Tattoo - Sylvain Runberg
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—The Vanishing Half - Brit Bennett
    Rating: 3 â­

    Intriguing at first, but gets messy and vague at the end. <br/><br/>

  • ğŸ“—The Flatshare - Beth O'Leary
    Rating: 4 â­

    It's more of a 3.75 star.<br/><br/>I found the plot to be very promising and had gripping subplots too which was capable of making it a great book and not just a one time read (at-least for me). The character Leon and Tiffy and their exchanges were cute and there where the occasional 'Awww' moments, but they

  • ğŸ“—The Unhoneymooners - Christina Lauren
    Rating: 5 â­

    LOVED IT!! The plot development of Olive and Ethan's story is well thought of and written. It made me giddy in the stomach while reading Olive's description of Ethan and her point of view. Though I felt that Olive's hate for Ethan was blown out of proportion in the beginning but the plot development

  • ğŸ“—The Midnight Library - Matt Haig
    Rating: 5 â­

    There are times, you come across a book that speaks to you in ways that you never thought a book can. 'The Midnight Library' is one such book.<br/>Its not a very complex book, even though it deals with some concept of quantum physics that are capable of blowing away even the sharpest of minds. <br/>It's not a

  • ğŸ“—Angels and Demons / The Da Vinci Code - Dan Brown
    Rating: 4 â­

  • ğŸ“—The House in the Cerulean Sea - T.J. Klune
    Rating: 5 â­

    It's a 4.5 stars for me.<br/><br/>The story is intriguing and will grab your attention from the first chapter itself. The characters are fun and interesting and helps to peak your interest. The story telling is seamless and makes you feel the world of Magical Youth is all you have always known. <br/><br/>I fell in love

  • ğŸ“—Looking for Alaska - John Green
    Rating: 3 â­

  • ğŸ“—A Man Called Ove - Fredrik Backman
    Rating: 5 â­

    A man called Ove, had been in my To-Read list for the longest time. I had heard and read a lot about it, but had been delaying my read owing to the fact that almost everyone says that its a heart breaking story. Now having read the book, I feel no review can do justice to Ove's story and the type of

  • ğŸ“—Anxious People - Fredrik Backman
    Rating: 4 â­

    This story is about a bank robbery, but not actually. <br/>It's about a hostage drama, but not really. <br/>In reality its about people, who are fighting, strangers bidding for the apartment, until they find out they are not very different at all. <br/><br/>This story is about a lot of things, but more so about hope, h

  • ğŸ“—Crooked Kingdom - Leigh Bardugo
    Rating: 5 â­

    5 BIG Stars!! Loveeeeeed this book. <br/><br/>Starting of this book felt like continuing from the first book itself, the same fast paced thrill like the first book was. Anyone reading this book directly before reading the first book wouldn't understand a lot of things and wouldn't enjoy it that much as well.

  • ğŸ“—The Wall of Winnipeg and Me - Mariana Zapata
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Six of Crows - Leigh Bardugo
    Rating: 5 â­

    Its an amazing read. I wasn't really expecting this book to be as good as it turned out to be. Not being fond of reading books on screen, I started reading this book on my phone (cause of Lockdown and not being able to get a copy of it), thinking probably that i will give up reading this in a day or

  • ğŸ“—Mockingjay - Suzanne Collins
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Shoe Dog: A Memoir by the Creator of Nike - Phil Knight
    Rating: 5 â­

    An Inspiration. <br/>Even though the book seemed a lil monotonous for my liking in the first part (I have taken a break, a long break from it in between), but the second half of the book and the whole book's essence in retrospect makes it a wonderful journey.<br/>It's not just a book I suppose, its a constant

  • ğŸ“—A Thousand Splendid Suns - Khaled Hosseini
    Rating: 5 â­

    A thousand Splendid Suns, was on my "Want to read" list for a long time, And it surely didn't disappoint.<br/>It's an emotional ride, heartbreaking at times. At the end it leaves you filled with gratitude and your heart goes out for Mariam and Laila, as well as for all the other people, especially women

  • ğŸ“—Kane & Abel - Jeffrey Archer
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Divergent - Veronica Roth
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Catching Fire - Suzanne Collins
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—The Kite Runner - Khaled Hosseini
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Eleanor Oliphant Is Completely Fine - Gail Honeyman
    Rating: 5 â­

    The first time when I read the title of the book, I thought what strange name the book has, but after reading the reviews, I decided to give it a read. And I am in love with Eleanor Oliphant and Raymond after completing the book, as you might have guessed.<br/><br/>The book is warm, thought provoking, emotion

  • ğŸ“—The Godfather - Mario Puzo
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Becoming - Michelle Obama
    Rating: 5 â­

    Becoming is one of those books which I didn't plan to read, but picked it up from a bookstore seeing a friends excitement about reading the book. I was searching for a good book to read, and becoming somehow felt right at that point. And I wasn't disappointed at all about my choice, after having com

  • ğŸ“—The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel Pie Society - Mary Ann Shaffer
    Rating: 5 â­

    The Guernsey Literary and Potato Peel pie Society is book which is as innovative as its name sounds, to add to that, it is written in the form of letters exchanged between people (Isn't that Wonderful?!)<br/><br/>Written at the post war era, this book gives you an idea of how people were recovering from the w

  • ğŸ“—The Lost Symbol - Dan Brown
    Rating: 0 â­

  • ğŸ“—Origin, Free Sampler - Dan Brown
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—The Da Vinci Code - Dan Brown
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Insurgent - Veronica Roth
    Rating: 4 â­

  • ğŸ“—Murder on the Orient Express - Agatha Christie
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—The Prince and the Dressmaker - Jen Wang
    Rating: 4 â­

  • ğŸ“—The Alchemist - Paulo Coelho
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets - J.K. Rowling
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Paper Towns - John Green
    Rating: 4 â­

  • ğŸ“—Born a Crime: Stories From a South African Childhood - Trevor Noah
    Rating: 3 â­

    I would rate it a 3.5 star.<br/><br/>Its a compilation of a lot of different stories from Noah's Childhood in Africa, and it does give us some idea about how life was in Africa during the Apartheid. The stories are funny, well written and engaging at points, but it is not quite a page turner, at least for me.

  • ğŸ“—Little Fires Everywhere - Celeste Ng
    Rating: 5 â­

    Little Fires Everywhere was in my to read list for a long time because of the fascinating reviews that I had read about it in the Good-reads community, and it proved to be just as fascinating and so much more. <br/>It's definitely a page turner and you will catch yourself sitting in one place and unable

  • ğŸ“—A Gentleman in Moscow - Amor Towles
    Rating: 3 â­

    3.5 Star, to be honest.<br/>Even though the book is witty, charming and interesting in places, I found a lack of a gripping story line in this novel. It mostly has elaborate description of minute details and daily activity of the Count, but after a point you lose interest and start hoping some turn of ev

  • ğŸ“—The Tattooist of Auschwitz - Heather Morris
    Rating: 3 â­

    I would rate this book a modest 3 Star, because not only did it not satisfy my expectations but it also failed to frame the story line of such an exceptional story, which has the potential to be so much more.<br/>The 3 star that the story gets is for the story itself, its for the tattooist and his journe

  • ğŸ“—The Help - Kathryn Stockett
    Rating: 5 â­

    An Engrossing read. <br/>Recommended.

  • ğŸ“—Wonder - R.J. Palacio
    Rating: 4 â­

  • ğŸ“—The Perks of Being a Wallflower - Stephen Chbosky
    Rating: 4 â­

  • ğŸ“—Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - J.K. Rowling
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Only Time Will Tell - Jeffrey Archer
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Origin - Dan Brown
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Digital Fortress - Dan Brown
    Rating: 4 â­

  • ğŸ“—Inferno - Dan Brown
    Rating: 0 â­

  • ğŸ“—Deception Point - Dan Brown
    Rating: 4 â­

  • ğŸ“—The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo - Stieg Larsson
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Angels & Demons - Dan Brown
    Rating: 0 â­

  • ğŸ“—The Fault in Our Stars - John Green
    Rating: 3 â­

  • ğŸ“—Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince - J.K. Rowling
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—The Da Vinci Code - Dan Brown
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone - J.K. Rowling
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—The Hunger Games - Suzanne Collins
    Rating: 5 â­

  • ğŸ“—Beartown - Fredrik Backman
    Rating: 4 â­

    A story that makes you keep turning pages. Its Unputdownable.<br/>And the best thing about it is that its so realistic than you feel like you yourself are in Beartown amidst everything that is going on. You feel like a part of it all.

item.content:

item.description: hello. I am Anda. And today is my Birthday. Wish me!!
